summary_points: 1. Sherwin-Williams amended its credit agreement to extend the maturity date of $75,000,000 in borrowing commitments from June 20, 2025, to June 20, 2030.
2.  Certain lenders and their affiliates provide Sherwin-Williams with various financial services and receive customary fees.
3. The amendment to the credit agreement became effective on March 10, 2025, contingent upon the Administrative Agent receiving signed counterparts and verification of representations and warranties.
1. At the March 4, 2025, annual meeting, Nordson Corp. shareholders elected three new directors to serve until 2028, and one new director to serve until 2026.
2.  92.86% of Nordson Corp.'s outstanding shares were represented at the March 4, 2025 annual meeting.
3. Victor L. Richey, Jr. was elected chair of the Board of Directors, effective March 4, 2025.
1. News Corp announced a daily buy-back notification on March 10, 2025, reporting the repurchase of 31,617,184 shares of Class A and Class B common stock, totaling approximately US$645,729,344.63.
2. As of March 7, 2025, News Corp had already repurchased approximately US$645,729,344.63 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, authorized to acquire up to US$1 billion of its outstanding shares, is ongoing and subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. On March 7, 2025, Progressive Corp appointed Carl G. Joyce as Vice President and Chief Accounting Officer, replacing Mariann Wojtkun Marshall.
2. The filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned numerically in this section of the filing.
1. ServiceNow announced on March 10, 2025, a definitive agreement to acquire Moveworks for $2.85 billion, with the closing expected in the second half of 2025.
2. ServiceNow's Pro Plus AI solution surpassed $200 million in annual contract value (ACV) as of December 31, 2024.
3.  The acquisition of Moveworks presents risks including challenges in integration, regulatory approvals, and potential disruption to Moveworks' business operations.

1. CrowdStrike's net income dramatically decreased from $89.33 million in fiscal year 2024 to a net loss of $19.27 million in fiscal year 2025, primarily due to a July 19, 2024, incident resulting in significant legal and professional service expenses.
2.  The company's dollar-based net retention rate dropped from 119% in fiscal year 2024 to 112% in fiscal year 2025.
3. Despite the net loss, CrowdStrike increased its cash equivalents to $4.0 billion as of January 31, 2025, from $3.1 billion a year prior.

1. John O. Larsen will retire as Chairman of the Board of Alliant Energy Corporation, Interstate Power & Light Company, and Wisconsin Power & Light Company after the 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
2. Patrick E. Allen, a board member since 2011, has been designated as the new Board Chair, effective after the 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
3. This 8-K filing, dated March 7, 2025, reports the departure of a director and the appointment of a new chair; no other significant developments or risks are mentioned.
1. On March 6th, 2025, DexCom, Inc. appointed Renée Galá as a director to its eleven-member board.
2. Ms. Galá received an initial equity grant of restricted stock units (RSUs) valued at $500,000, vesting annually over three years, plus a pro-rata annual grant of RSUs worth $56,986.
3.  A change in control of DexCom would trigger full and immediate vesting of outstanding equity awards held by non-employee directors.
1. Cincinnati Financial's 2024 Property and Casualty premium growth of 13% significantly exceeded its 15-year CAGR of 8%.
2.  The company's 2024 combined ratio was 96.5%, which included $26 million in net unfavorable reserve development.
3.  Cincinnati Financial projected a 6% to 10% increase in Property and Casualty premiums for 2025,  a prediction made in March 2022.
1. Diamondback Energy, Inc. entered into an Underwriting Agreement on March 6, 2025, to issue $1,200,000,000 of 5.550% Senior Notes due 2035, with an expected closing on March 20, 2025.
2. The net proceeds from the note sale are expected to be approximately $1.19 billion,  a portion of which will fund the pending acquisition of Double Eagle subsidiaries.
3.  The Underwriting Agreement includes customary representations, warranties, covenants, indemnification, and contribution provisions.
1. Emerson Electric Co. extended the deadline for its tender offer to acquire Aspen Technology, Inc. to 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time on March 11, 2025.
2.  The initial tender offer price was $265 per share.

3. The acquisition is subject to several conditions, including at least a majority of AspenTech's outstanding shares being tendered, and the possibility of competing offers or government intervention poses risks to the transaction's completion.
1. On March 7, 2025, Cardinal Health, Inc. added Robert Musslewhite and Sudhakar Ramakrishna to its Board of Directors.
2.  Both new board members have extensive experience leading technology companies; Musslewhite in healthcare and Ramakrishna in broader technology.
3.  The compensation for the new directors will be consistent with that of other non-employee directors, as detailed in the company's 2024 Schedule 14A proxy statement.
1. Insulet Corporation and NXP USA, Inc. amended their Purchase Agreement on March 7, 2025, extending its term and modifying pricing, volume, warranties, and product modifications.
2.  The amendment, effective January 1, 2025, covers purchases from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2025, with purchase orders already placed for the first two quarters of 2025.
3.  Significant portions of the Addendum to the Purchase Agreement are redacted as confidential, limiting the full understanding of the agreement's details.

1. Cencora, Inc. raised its fiscal year 2025 adjusted diluted earnings per share (EPS) guidance from $15.25 to $15.55 to $15.30 to $15.60, as of March 10, 2025, citing continued momentum in its core U.S. Healthcare Solutions segment.
2. This updated guidance, released on March 10, 2025, does not reflect any change in expectations for the recently completed acquisition of Retina Consultants of America.

3.  The company's  March 10, 2025 filing states that a reconciliation of the non-GAAP financial measure to the most comparable GAAP financial measure is not provided on a forward-looking basis due to the difficulty of accurately estimating reconciling items.
